answerText: "Hap"[10] "Hap" was written by this poet, who wrote the novels Far From the Madding Crowd and The Mayor of Casterbridge.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 16 | 16 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The sestet of this sonnet laments that "crass Casualty obstructs the sun and rain, and dicing Time for gladness casts a moan." For 10 points each: [10] Name this sonnet, whose speaker hopes that "some vengeful god would call to me" and laugh, "Thou suffering thing, know that thy sorrow is my ecstasy, that thy love's loss is my hate's profiting!"
